name: Kenmare Bay Holiday Homes & Lodges

reviews.text: my family and I decided to go to kenmare for the weekend. After much debating we decided to book a lodge as it was easier as the children could go out and play and we would be able to relax known they were safe and not confined to a hotel room. We booked the forelands house as it sleeps up to 8 and there was 9 of us which included a baby. On arrival the receptionist was Jason who was very helpful given us directions, and information on where was best to carry the younger children. When we arrived at the forelands I was very disappointed. I went out to the back yard to find it was a communal yard shared between 3 houses and gardens over grown really not suitable for the children as we were told, However I rang reception and I cannot give them enough credit they sorted us out with lodges and I must say they were beautiful. 5 stars to be fair. Lodges are beautiful modern decorated and the back gardens which was our main point of our weekend were lovely and secure. We had a lovely weekend in Kenmare and the Kenmare bay staff were very nice and considerate. I cannot comment on food as we did the cooking in the lodge but We were all happy and will definitely be returning again.
reviews.title: family weekend break

reviews.text: Lodges have everything you need to make your stay comfortable. Unfortunately, guests are allocated one key which is a bit inconvenient in a group of four people. The 10:00am check out was disappointng. Overall a very relaxing and enjoyable place to stay.
reviews.title: 5* lodges - luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel bar was very quiet during our stay. Kenmare is a 3 minute walk and there are plenty of lovely bars/restaurants serving good food with lots of choice for all the family. Some play traditional music in the evening. Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: What more could you ask for?

reviews.text: We stayed booked the 5* lodge and stayed on 13 January of this year. We stayed in lodge 19, a two bed house. I think at some point we've all looked at pictures of hotel rooms on their website and you book based on the assumption that the hotel is being honest with what they advertise as 'standard' room or a 'delux' room. However when you subsequently check in, you have no idea why you were put in the smallest and only room in the hotel not renovated in the past 50 years and have no idea where they got the photos from....this is NOT the case here. What you see is what you get. 5* accommodation through and through.
reviews.title: Great Value and Luxury

reviews.text: The quality of the lodge was of the highest standard. Room sizes were good (including bathrooms), and the beds were comfortable. There is a sofa bed in one of the double rooms but to be honest if there is more 4 people staying in total, book another lodge. The pull out bed is tiny, suited for children rather than adults and makes it impossible to get in one side of the bed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lodges

reviews.text: Holiday home that really had everything. Easy check in/out. Absolutely no hassle. Close to town, walking distance, but quiet. Just perfect. Would really be happy to recommend these houses to friends and family.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: We decided to book a home instead of hotel rooms and we were delighted in the end as we could come and go without any hassle. We were golfing for 4 days in the area and very much enjoyed the trip. The golf courses were tops although a bit wet. Kenmare restaurants are a bit on the expensive side and as a result we only ate out 2 nights out of the 3. We had full use of the Hotels pool and it is very nice and kept very clean. The Hotel itself looks lovely, we only used the bar and pool.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.text: We (2 adults and 3 kids) stayed in the Kenmare Bay Holiday Homes during August and were very impressed with the 3-bed house. Good quality beds and linen, loads of towels, toilet roll, kitchen roll. The house was well stocked for a holiday home i.e. cleaning supplies (including a couple of dishwasher & washing machine tabs). Lots of pots, pans, crockery, washer/drier, etc. The only thing that was missing was a clothes line (outdoor). There was a clothes horse but it was small and of poor quality...certainly not able for towels / swim gear after a day at the beach. But that's just a minor complaint. We were very happy with the house itself. We had use of the hotel pool and used it several times. The kids really enjoyed it....lots of toys/floats available. We didn't use the kids camp so can't comment on it. The hotel had a small playground but we didn't use it as the ground around it was far too wet...it could do with an upgrade/relocation in the grounds. There is a nicer playground near Supervalu in Kenmare. As advertised, the walk into Kenmare was very short and we enjoyed wandering in for some delicious homemade icecream.
reviews.title: Happy Times in the Holiday Homes...mostly....

reviews.text: I had one issue with the holiday homes but perhaps I should have expected it.... we stayed Saturday - Saturday. For the first six nights, there were familes in the neighbouring houses. However on the final Friday, we observed a large group of men moving into those houses (stag? golf weekend? Not sure). Anyway those guys were really loud - shouting across to each other at 12am, 2am, 3am as they arrived back from the pub. While they were just having fun & "craic", they didn't consider that there was a family with small kids living between their houses. I mentioned to the hotel receptionist the next morning that perhaps the hotel should consider keeping the families isolated from these potentially-loud bookings. The girl on reception did apologise but I guess she hasn't much control over this type of thing. I guess I should have asked to speak to the manager but, as we were anxious to get on the road, I didn't persue it further. I'd advise families with small kids (or adults who are light sleepers) to ask for an "end" house....rather than be sandwiched between noisy revellers..
reviews.title: Fantastic for families - great holiday guaranteed regardless of the weather

reviews.text: We (2 adults 3 children) spent a wonderful 4 days in the Lodge houses and will definitely be going back. The kids had a fantastic time playing out on the green area every evening with the other kids and we were able to relax knowing they were safe and contented there. The house was great - really spacious and stylish (I was concerned about it being a 2 bed but it was perfect for our family) but we had space to entertain friends for dinner on one evening and reckon that they now will be palnning a trip there also. The next time I would definitely hope we can stay longer. The short little walk to kenmare village was really manageable several times per day even for our 3 year old. There was so many thing that we could have done at the hotel and in the area but simply ran out of time so must go back. On the lazy food days we sometimes went to the hotel for breakfast they have a kids corner for the smaller kids and you could easily have a long one. The hotel facilities and 3 sets of activities per day in the hotel for the kids really meant there was time for parents to relax. We used a babysitter recommended by the hotel and had a lovely adults only dinner in Packies - all arranged by the hotel staff. Now that I write this I am starting to think when can we go again!!!
reviews.title: Family fantastic

reviews.text: Stayed in Kenmare bay holiday home 1. This is privately owned! The house is beautiful. Very well equipped! Very bright and spacious! Only a 5 min walk to shops pubs and numerous restaurants! Perfect location for sight seeing the ring of Kerry! Will definitely be back. Loved every minute of my holiday! Plus the weather was lovely! No rain!!!!
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.text: We stayed at the Forelands Holiday Homes at Kenmare Bay Hotel in April 2013 for Easter Holidays. I was accompanied by my Husband, Mother & 2 children (aged 2 & 5) When we arrived at the Forelands Holiday Homes I was rather worried as the houses are badly in need of some tender loving care on the outside (a lick of paint would help!). Having said that I thankfully couldn't fault the inside, very comfortable houses, nice beds & very clean. We also used the swimming pool facilites, the Spa which were both great. My son also loved the kids club, which was priced at €5 per class (2 hours) which was great value. Would recommend to anyone with young children, also travelled to Killarney from Kenmare through Moll's Gap which is simply stunning and a must....
reviews.title: Forelands Holiday Homes

reviews.text: We stayed here July 2012 for a week in one of the 3 bed holiday homes. Perfectly clean and with everything you need for an enjoyable stay (we have 3 young boys). Ring ahead to time to specify any extra's you need (stairs gates etc).
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: Leisure facilities are good but needed a wee bit tlc (which may have been done since we stayed).
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.text: Its only a short scenic walk into Kenmare (which we did most days and boys loved). Its a lovely town with some great wee shops.
reviews.title: exceptional

reviews.text: Just returned from a week in the luxury lodges . We had a ball , the staff in Kenmare Bay from the moment of booking were wonderful . We had a large family party travelling with the older folks staying in the hotel . Everyone from 2 yrs old up to 80 years had a ball . The teenagers loved the swimming pool , the younger ones went to the kids club and made us all shortbread biscuits which were delicious . Many thanks we will be back , perfect location and houses were clean , well kept and stocked .
reviews.title: Great holiday with extended family

reviews.text: We stayed at the Forelands cottages which are in a separate residential complex set just a little distance from the hotel. The first impression wasn't great as there are signs about land nearby not belonging to the Forelands and For Sale signs, long grass and unkempt bushes. I did worry that the house would be terrible. However it was very good. Three good size double rooms for the 6 of us. The only strange design point was that the main bathroom had the toilet right up against the bath making it very difficult to get in the shower and bathe the kids. Otherwise the house was fine with plenty of space. But it just didn't feel like part of the hotel and the outside space had no BBQ or chairs to enjoy the nice week we were having outside.
reviews.title: Forelands cottages ok but a bit neglected outside
Lovely relaxing "home from home" in Kenmare
reviews.text: The hotel pool facilities were very good. But I didn't enjoy using the restaurant. A couple of bus loads were due so we were put in the kids corner where we watched 2 unsupervised darlings bashing the other little one with the toys. Couldn't wait to leave and didn't return for another go.

The location of the cottage was good, just a quick walk from town which meant that we could have a glass of something in town and not worry about driving. But walking over to the hotel wasn't overly great with the kids as there isn't much in the way of a footpath.
reviews.title: 2 night break with kids

reviews.text: There is a good supermarket only a couple of minutes walk away with prepay petrol pumps.
reviews.title: Superb holiday home in superb location

description: The Kenmare Bay Holiday Homes & Lodges are situated in the grounds of the Kenmare Bay Hotel, just a short stroll into the town centre of the quaint town of Kenmare. Enjoy all the facilities that the hotel has to offer combined with the comforts of your own home. Each 3 bedroom holiday home comprises of: Master ensuite double bedroom; Twin bedroom; Single bedroom; Bright & Spacious kitchen/dining room with all modern conveniences; Living area with fold out sofa bed, multi chanenel TV/DVD unit and open fire; Cot and highchair; downstairs toilet; semi-private garden; parking.Each 2 bedroom Lodge comprises of: 2 Master en-suite king-size bedrooms, which can be twins or doubles; A sofa bed in one of the bedrooms; Fully fitted kitchen; Open plan dining room and lounge area with LCD TV and DVD player and MP3 docking station; Private garden; Parking.
